details.title: Correction to “Accelerated Life Test Planning With Independent Weibull Competing Risks With Known Shape Parameter” [Mar 07 85-93]
details.abstract: In the above titled paper (ibid., vol. 56, no. 1, pp. 85-93, Mar 07), there were a number of errors. A list of corrections is presented here.

references.title:
Accelerated life test planning with independent
Weibull competing risks with known shape parameter

context.text:
Below is a list of corrections for the above article [1]:

•The equation in Theorem 5.2 should read: 

•The correct planning values in the 4th and 5th paragraphs of Section 7 are \$\sigma=15, \hat{\gamma}_{10}=-15.3626, \hat{\gamma}_{11}=\$. 7007, \$\hat{\gamma}_{20}= -17.5732, \hat{\gamma}_{21} \simeq\$. 8079, \$\beta_{10}=\$ 2.5829, \$\beta_{11} =-2.0983, \beta_{20}=3.1180, \beta_{21}=-2.4193\$, t emp \$=160, 170, 180, 190 ^{\circ} \mathrm{c}, (x_{1}=-.3949, p_{1}=.0006), (x_{2}=-.1930, p_{2}=.0105), (x_{3}=0, p_{3}=.\ 1467), (x_{4}=.\ 1847, \ p_{4}=.8810)\$.

•The captions for TABLE II and TABLE III should read: … \$\sigma= 15, \beta_{10}=2.5829, \beta_{11}=-2.0983, \beta_{20}=3.1180, \beta_{21} = -2.4193, \ldots\$.

links.abstract: This article presents methodology for accelerated life test (ALT) planning when there are two or more failure modes, or competing risks which are dependent on one accelerating factor. It is assumed that the failure modes have respective latent (unobservable) failure times, and the minimum of these times corresponds to the product lifetime. The latent failure times are assumed to be s-independently distributed Weibull with known, common shape parameter. Expressions for the Fisher information matr...

references.text: F. Pascual, "Accelerated life test planning with independent Weibull competing risks with known shape parameter", IEEE Trans. Rel, vol. 56, pp. 85-93, March 2007.

nonIeee.title: Accelerated life test planning with independent lognormal competing risks
nonIeee.displayText: Francis Pascual, "Accelerated life test planning with independent lognormal competing risks", Journal of Statistical Planning and Inference, vol. 140, pp. 1089, 2010, ISSN 03783758.
